oai_dc:dc.dc:title: On the Well-posedness for the Chen-Lee equation in periodic Sobolev spaces
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Pastrán, Ricardo A.
Riaño, Oscar G.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Mathematics - Analysis of PDEs
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: We prove that the initial value problem associated to a perturbation of the Benjamin-Ono equation or Chen-Lee equation $u_t+uu_x+\beta \mathcal{H}u_{xx}+\eta (\mathcal{H}u_x - u_{xx})=0$, where $x\in \mathbb{T}$, $t> 0$, $\eta >0$ and $\mathcal{H}$ denotes the usual Hilbert transform, is locally and globally well-posed in the Sobolev spaces $H^s(\mathbb{T})$ for any $s>-\frac{1}{2}$. We also prove some ill-posedness issues when $s<-1$.
